lead_paragraph: At a joyful ceremony, parents of the freed Nigerian girls heard them describe their two years of captivity.

byline.contributor: Chris Stein reported from Abuja, and Dionne Searcey from Dakar, Senegal.
byline.original: By CHRIS STEIN and DIONNE SEARCEY

headline.print_headline: Freed Girls in Nigeria, Reuniting With Parents, Tell of Servitude and Privation
headline.main: 21 Chibok Schoolgirls, Reuniting With Parents, Tell of Boko Haram Slavery

snippet: At a joyful ceremony, parents of the freed Nigerian girls heard them describe their two years of captivity....
abstract: Twenty one freed girls in Nigeria, reuniting with parents and family, tell of their two years of servitude and privation after being kidnapped by Boko Haram; Nigerian government negotiated their freedom, but many other girls remain captive.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: International Committee of the Red Cross
